body:
spack fails to successfully download openssl.
I can take the url that spack uses and download the openssl tarball outside of spack.
This is using the latest develop branch with no changes of my own.

[jeg@localhost packages]$ spack install openssl
==> Installing openssl
==> zlib is already installed in /home/jeg/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora19-x86_64/gcc-4.8.3/zlib-1.2.8-dsippf4eh5645v5bsx7zgtbxlg3zg7yo
==> Trying to fetch from file:///home/jeg/spack/var/spack/cache/openssl/openssl-1.0.2h.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /home/jeg/spack/var/spack/cache/openssl/openssl-1.0.2h.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///home/jeg/spack/var/spack/cache/openssl/openssl-1.0.2h.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to fetch from https://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.2h.tar.gz

curl: (35) Encountered end of file
==> Fetching from https://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.2h.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: All fetchers failed for openssl-1.0.2h-ltfk4yq76mpmygak5spk6ys3owedgc5r
==> Error: Installation process had nonzero exit code : 256
[jeg@localhost packages]$
title: spack fails to successfully download openssl.
